title: Worlds Together Worlds Apart Chapters 9
description: Review set for Mr Diffley's World History class

list.definition: The western, coastal region of the Arabian Peninsula. It was the site of the holy cities of Mecca and Medina.
The holiest city of Islam; Muhammad's birthplace
Muhammad's move to Medina. Start of the Islamic calendar (632 CE)
The community of all Muslims
The holy book of Islam
Traditional records of the deeds of Muhammad, and his quotations
Declaration of faith, prayer, alms, fasting, and pilgrimage
The first four rulers of the Islamic world (632-661) after the death of Muhammad. They were chosen by the umma.
A holy struggle or striving by a Muslim for a moral or spiritual or political goal
An Arabic term that means the "house of Islam" and that refers to lands under Islamic rule
An Arabic term that means the "house of war" and that refers to lands under non-Islamic rule
The first hereditary dynasty of Muslim caliphs (661 to 750 CE). From their capital at Damascus, they ruled an empire that extended from Spain to India. Overthrown by the Abbasid Caliphate.

list.term: Treatment of non-Arabs in the Umayyad Caliphate
list.definition: Non-Arabs had to pay a special tax and were not allowed to convert to Islam. They were also not allowed to serve in the military.
The dynasty that came after the Umayyads. They moved the capital to Baghdad. They were more tolerant of non-Arabs and allowed them to serve in the military.
Islamic religious scholars
Islamic law; a combination of the Quran and the Hadith.

list.term: Changing status of women in Islam
list.definition: Women had set rights now, but also had set strictures they must follow
A center of learning established in Baghdad in the 800s
Muslim Spain; religiously diverse
A mosque in Spain that was converted to a Christian church when the Christians took over the city
A family of Persian descent that served the Abbasid caliphs in Baghdad
